This manual describes version &appversion; of &app;.
Feedback
To report a bug or make a suggestion regarding the &app; application or this manual, follow the directions in the GNOME Feedback Page.

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: The &app; application enables you to perform the following actions:

listitem.para: View a file in ASCII or hexadecimal format simultaneously.
Edit a file in either ASCII or hexadecimal format.

sect2.title: To Start &app;
sect2.para: You can start &app; in the following ways:

listitem.para: Choose AccessoriesHex Editor.
Execute the following command: ghex2

sect2.title: When You Start &app;
sect2.para: When you start &app;, the following window is displayed.

figure.title: &app; Window Before You Open a File

textobject.phrase: Shows GHex main window before you open a file.

sect2.title: To Open a File
sect2.para: To open a file, choose FileOpen. Select the file that you want to open, then click OK. You can open multiple files in &app;. &app; displays each file in a new window.
When you open a file in &app;, the application displays the file in the following window.

textobject.phrase: Shows GHex main window with an open file

sect2.para: The &app; window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: The menus on the menubar contain all the commands that you need to work with files in &app;.
The cursor offset is the distance between the beginning of the file and the first byte in each line. By default, &app; displays the cursor offsets column to the left of the hexadecimal view.
The display pane on the left side of the display area displays a hexadecimal view of the file.
The display pane on the right side of the display area displays an ASCII view of the file.
The type conversion dialog below the display area displays the value of the selected character in several different numeric types.

sect2.title: To Edit a File
sect2.para: To edit a file, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Click in the hexadecimal or ASCII view of the file. The view in which the cursor is active displays a full cursor. The view in which the cursor is not active displays an outline of the cursor.
Use any of the following methods to move the cursor around the file:
Use the scrollbar on the window or the arrow keys on the keyboard to scroll through the file.
Choose EditGoto Byte, type the cursor offset as a decimal or hexadecimal value, then click OK. The format of the hexadecimal value must be 0x followed by the offset, for example 0x3.
Edit the ASCII format in the same way you edit a normal text file. To edit the hexadecimal format, use the values 0 to 9 and a to f.

sect2.para: To insert data and not overwrite existing data, choose EditInsert Mode.
To cut, copy, and paste data, choose EditCut, EditCopy, and EditPaste.

To undo an edit, choose EditUndo. To redo an edit, choose EditRedo. The number of previous edits that you can undo is determined by the Maximum number of undo levels setting in the tabbed section of the Preferences dialog.

sect2.title: To Save a File
sect2.para: You can save a file in the following ways:

listitem.para: To save changes to the current file, choose FileSave.
To save the current file under a new filename, choose FileSave As. Enter a name for the file in the Select a file to save buffer as dialog, then click OK.

sect2.title: To Revert to the Last Saved Version of a File
sect2.para: To revert to the last version of the current file that you saved and undo all of the edits that you made to the file since you last saved the file, choose FileRevert, then click Yes in the Question dialog.

sect2.title: To Find Data in a File
sect2.para: To search a file for a hexadecimal or ASCII string, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Choose EditFind.
In the Find Data dialog, choose one of the following options:
Type the string that you want to find.
Click Find Next to find the next occurrence of the string.
Click Find Previous to find the previous occurrence of the string.
Click Cancel to close the Find Data dialog.

sect2.title: To Perform an Advanced Find
sect2.para: To perform an advanced find, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Choose EditAdvanced Find.
In the Find Data dialog, select the required search criteria. For information about how to add new search criteria, see .
Click Find Next to find the next occurrence of the string.
Click Find Previous to find the previous occurrence of the string.
Click Close to close the Find Data dialog.

sect2.title: To Add Search Criteria
sect2.para: To add search criteria, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Choose EditAdvanced Find.
In the Find Data dialog, click Add New.
In the Find Data: Add Search dialog, choose one of the following options:
Type the string that you want to find.
Use the color wheel or the spin boxes to select a color to highlight the search criteria.
Click Add.
Click Cancel to close the Find Data dialog.

sect2.title: To Remove Search Criteria
sect2.para: To remove search criteria, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Choose EditAdvanced Find.
In the Find Data dialog, select the search criteria that you want to remove.
Click Remove Selected.
Click Cancel to close the Find Data dialog.

sect2.title: To Find and Replace Data in a File
sect2.para: To search a file for a hexadecimal or ASCII string and then replace the string, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Choose EditReplace.
In the Find & Replace Data dialog, choose one of the following options:
In the first text box, type the string that you want to find.
In the second text box, type the string that you want to use to replace the string that you find.
Click Find Next.
Click Replace to replace the current occurrence of the string or click Replace All to replace all occurrences of the string.
Click Cancel to close the Find & Replace Data dialog.

sect2.title: To Add or Remove Additional Views of a File
sect2.para: To add another view of the current file to your &app; window, choose ViewAdd View.
To remove a view of the current file, choose ViewRemove View. If you remove the last view that is open, the application exits.

sect2.title: To Change the Data Group Type
sect2.para: To change how &app; displays the hexadecimal content of a file in the &app; window, choose ViewGroup Data As, then select one of the following menu items:

listitem.para: Bytes - single bytes
Words - groups of two bytes
Longwords - groups of four bytes

sect2.title: To Export the &app; Display to HTML
sect2.para:
To export the data contained in the &app; window to HTML, choose FileSave As HTML. Choose a directory and specify a filename for the HTML file, then click OK. &app; implements the following actions:
Creates a separate HTML file for each page of data that is displayed in the &app; window.
Uses the HTML filename that you specify as the basis for the filename.
Appends a page number to the filename to differentiate the files.
For example, if you specify the filename log.html, &app; creates a series of HTML files named log00000000.html, log00000001.html, log00000002.html, and so on.

sect2.title: To View a Character Table
sect2.para: To view a table that contains the ASCII, hexadecimal, decimal, octal, and binary representations for the values 0 to 255, choose WindowsCharacter Table.

sect2.title: To View Data Conversions
sect2.para: To display the binary, decimal, hexadecimal, and ASCII conversions for up to four bytes of data, perform the following steps:

listitem.para: Choose WindowsBase Converter.
Perform one of the following actions:
Type the data that you want to convert in one of the fields in the Base Converter dialog, then press Return.
To display the conversions for the data at the cursor position in the current file, click on the Get cursor value button.
&app; updates the values of the other fields to display the data conversions.
Click Close to close the Base Converter dialog.

sect2.title: To Show or Hide the Type Conversion Dialog
sect2.para: To show or hide the type conversion dialog, choose WindowsType Conversion Dialog.
The type conversion dialog displays the value of the selected character in the following representations:
The type conversion dialog also contains the following options:

listitem.para: Select this option to show little endian decoding.

term.guilabel: Show unsigned and float as hexadecimal

listitem.para: Select this option to show unsigned and float numbers as hexadecimal numbers.

sect2.title: To Print a File
sect2.para: To print a file, choose FilePrint. Select the print options that you require in the Print dialog, then click OK.
To preview a printed copy of the file, choose FilePrint Preview.

sect1.title: Preferences
sect1.para: To configure &app;, choose EditPreferences. The Preferences dialog contains the following tabbed sections:

listitem.para: Use this spin box to specify the maximum number of edits that you can undo.

term.guilabel: Show cursor offset in statusbar as

listitem.para: Use this drop-down list to select the format in which the cursor offset is displayed. The format can be decimal, hexadecimal, or a custom print style string that only contains the format specifiers x, o, and s.
Select this option to display the cursor offsets in a column to the left of the hexadecimal view of the &app; window.
Use the font selector list boxes to edit the existing font information or type new font information. Specify a font type, style, and size to display the contents of files in &app;.
Select one of the following options to specify how &app; displays the hexadecimal content of a file in the &app; window:
Bytes - single bytes
Words - groups of two bytes
Longwords - groups of four bytes
Click on the Data font button to specify the font type, style, and size to use to print the data contained in a file.
Click on the Header font button to specify the font type, style, and size to use to print the header information that is contained in the file.

Use this spin box to specify the number of lines that &app; alternately prints with a surrounding shaded box. If the value of the spin box is 10, &app; prints the first 10 lines of the file without a shaded box, the next 10 lines with a shaded box, and so on. If the value of the spin box is 0, &app; does not print any shaded box.
